Key Match Events: Ben Stokes hit the winning runs for England, securing a 4-wicket victory
Pathum Nissanka scored 67 runs for Sri Lanka
England joined New Zealand in the T20 World Cup semi-finals
Pre-Game Insights: England defeated Sri Lanka by 4 wickets
Ben Stokes emerged as an efficient finisher despite the team's struggles against Sri Lankan spinners
Sri Lanka's start was great with Pathum Nissanka playing responsibly
Post-Match Reflections: England entered the T20 World Cup semi-finals
Australia lost all hopes of winning the World Cup
England's victory was crucial for their playoff push
Miscellaneous Highlights: The match was played at the Sydney Cricket Ground (SCG)
England's probable playing XI included Jos Buttler, Alex Hales, Dawid Malan, Ben Stokes, Harry Brook, Moeen Ali, Liam Livingstone, Sam Curran, Chris Woakes, Adil Rashid, Mark Wood

Sri Lanka's probable playing XI included Pathum Nissanka, Kusal Mendis, Dhananjaya de Silva, Charith Asalanka, Bhanuka Rajapaksa, Dasun Shanaka, Wanindu Hasaranga, Maheesh Theekshana, Pramod Madushan, Lahiru Kumara, Kasun Rajitha
